intro: Ruellia bourgaei, commonly known as the Mexican bluebell, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers bloom in clusters at the ends of the branches, creating a showy display. Ruellia bourgaei is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
